page_analysis.text_content:
Projections

Bay windows

Bay windows that meet the design criteria below are considered to be decorative architectural features and do NOT count toward gross floor area.

Architectural relief features such as bay windows are pleasant additions to a house design and are encouraged. If they meet certain design criteria they do not count toward gross floor area.

Design criteria for bay windows that do not count:

• Bottom of feature must be at least 18" above the floor joists
• Exterior supports must be features like corbels and/or brackets rather than solid walls
• At least 50% of the surface is glass

Fig 13 Bay windows

2' max. from bay window surface to facade surface (Typical all)

18" min. from top of floor joists to bottom of bay window structure

A
Does NOT count

B
Counts because floor joists continue into the bay window

C & D
Count because of exterior skirt wall (angled or straight)

E
Counts because the surface is not at least 50% glass

Note: Bay windows that extend higher than the structure's roof are considered to be dormers and count toward gross floor area.

Code sections
18.04.030(a)(65)
18.12.040(b)Table 3

18

visual_elements.description: Figure 13 showing five different bay window configurations labeled A through E. Each shows a cross-sectional view of bay windows with different structural supports and features. Configuration A shows a bay window that does not count, B shows floor joists continuing into the bay window, C & D show exterior skirt walls (angled or straight), and E shows a bay window that is not at least 50% glass. The diagram includes measurement annotations showing 2' max distance from bay window surface to facade surface and 18" minimum distance from top of floor joists to bottom of bay window structure.

qualifiers.text: Bay windows that meet the design criteria below
If they meet certain design criteria

conditions.text: Bottom of feature must be at least 18" above the floor joists
Exterior supports must be features like corbels and/or brackets rather than solid walls
conditions.threshold_value: corbels and/or brackets rather than solid walls

conditions.text: At least 50% of the surface is glass
Bay windows that extend higher than the structure's roof are considered to be dormers and count toward gross floor area

logical_relationships.expression: All three design criteria must be met for bay windows to not count toward gross floor area
If bay windows extend higher than the structure's roof, then they are considered dormers and count toward gross floor area

execution_sequence.action: Evaluate if bay window meets all three design criteria
Check if bay window extends above roof line
Determine if bay window counts toward gross floor area based on criteria evaluation
